section.section: A request for DNA information under paragraph (1) of this subsection must be in furtherance of a purpose set forth in § 2-505 of this subtitle.

The typing results and personal identification information of the DNA profile of an individual in the statewide DNA data base system shall be made available to a defendant or defendant's counsel on written order of the court in which the case is pending.

A search of the data base to determine the existence of a match to DNA obtained from crime scene evidence taken in relation to the crime for which a defendant is charged shall be conducted if:
the defendant requests the search; and
a court issues a written order for the search.
This subtitle does not limit a court from ordering discovery of a DNA record or other related material in a criminal case.
The Director shall maintain a file of all orders issued under this subsection.
